thread.title: Sixfields Stadium development company winding-up petition approved
thread.title_full: Sixfields Stadium development company winding-up petition approved

title: Sixfields Stadium development company winding-up petition approved
text:
Sixfields Stadium development company winding-up petition approved © Getty Images The winding-up petition issued to Sixfields Stadium development company Buckingham Group is approved at a court hearing in Birmingham. By Daniel Lewis , Football League CorrespondentFiled:   12:18   12:18 UK 
The winding-up petition against the development company behind Northampton Town 's Sixfields Stadium revamp has been approved. 
Buckingham Group took legal action against County Developments Ltd over the non-payment of around £3m-worth of work carried out on the Cobblers' home. 
A court hearing was held in Birmingham on Thursday morning, seven days after a winding-up petition was initially issued by HM Revenue and Customs. 
Speaking in the aftermath of the hearing, Buckingham Group director Tim Brown is quoted by the Northampton Chronicle as saying: "As a contracting organisation we have put more seats in stadia than any other UK contractor. It is the first time we have ever encountered a situation such as this." 
Brown also claimed that Buckingham will now look to recover the money, while also considering a plan to resume work on Sixfields' East Stand.
